column1: Using a path analytic approach, the study statistically supported three gendered pathways to women offenders' incarceration: (a) a pathway beginning with childhood experiences that contributed to historical and current forms of mental_illness and substance wellness; (b) a relational pathway in which women's supportive intimate relationships facilitated adult empowerment, increases in self-efficacy, and current mental_illness and substance health; and (c) a social and human capital pathway in which women's growth in the areas of education, family support, and self-efficacy, as well as relationship development, contributed to employment opportunities and avoidance of imprisonment.
